results.title: Pitcha this : the black cockatoos (Swan Hill) : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Anna Williams, Daniel Edwards, Judith Rigney, Marion Beeton, Patty Donaczy, Ramptha Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Six stories from members of the Swan Hill Indigenous community. Parents, children and inspirational family members are celebrated in these stories, connecting the participants to their heritage.

results.title: My tribe
results.creator_credit: Judith Rigney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Judith Rigney’s family are the love of her life. At age 22, Rigney gave birth to her first child. Here she proudly and lovingly pays tribute her ‘tribe’.

results.title: The Cape Barren boy
results.creator_credit: Marion Beeton, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Marion Beeton is proud of his father, Clive Beeton. A talented musician who wrote his own songs, he learnt to play the guitar through listening to the wireless.

results.title: Art 4 Starts
results.creator_credit: Sonya Waters, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: What other people consider vandalism or graffiti, Sonya Waters sees as street art. Behind the work, Waters recognises the skill and social commentary inherent in the work and seeks to help the artists, often kids from disadvantaged backgrounds, recognise the artistic and social value of their work and become empowered by it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sonya Waters, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Unwise and foolish creations of fancy
results.creator_credit: Sally McCutcheon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sally McCutcheon tells her story, threaded together by her two life-long passions, dancing and beading. Through determination, discipline and the support of her family, McCutcheon has managed to excel at both at different stages of her life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sally McCutcheon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Princes Street Port Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Lyn McLeavy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A tribute to a suburb, a family and a lady who liked to play the piano and sing the blues. Lyn McLeavey describes growing up in Port Melbourne in the 1950s, blending in the harsh realities of life as the daughter of a traumatised ‘wharfie’, with the simple joy of the sounds of the streets.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lyn McLeavy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Coming home
results.creator_credit: Louise Blake, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite being born in Canberra, Louise Blake’s family history has very strong ties to Melbourne. Over the years, family trips have drawn Blake ‘south of the border’, where suburbs like Port Melbourne and Brunswick evoke stories from her family history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louise Blake, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Weeding wars in peaceful places
results.creator_credit: Llywellyn Staiff, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Flora, fauna and bushland is what makes Maroondah and Australia different to anywhere else in the world. The agenda of Llywellyn and her colleagues is to protect what’s left.
